page.title: 14 The Round Church
page.content: At{Lt.Maplestead}there is a round church, one of only five in England, built ain 1335 by the{Knights {Hospitallers,}as a copy of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem. The village and church were given to the Knights Hospitallers by Julian Fitz-Audelin c.1185. The Knights Hospitallers had set up a hospital in Jerusalem to care for pilgrims, and a hospital was built at Lt. Maplestead to care for the sick in this country. Henry V111 closed all religious houses and monasteries in 1540 but because the Round Church was used by people in the village it was allowed to remain. The Knights lost all their lands and they were given to a family called Wiseman.There are still Wisemans in the village-Richard is a pupil at our school and Mrs.Wiseman is our mid- day assistant.
